chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Kevin W Pavwoski was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 3/01/2017; alternate 27 days jail huber, consecutive.

DNA and Blood draw costs to be paid along with fine on payment plan with fine.
Blood costs will be forwarded to the Waukesha Sheriff's dept. once they are paid.

With Huber.
Standard release.
Credit for 38 days.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Follow through with Alcohol Assessment.
Defendant to attend Victim Impact Panel as well.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Count 4 was dismissed outright.

records.addlTxt: sent to Kevin Pavwoski on 12/16/16
Inmate Communication Form from Kevin Pavwoski regarding community service
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Kevin W Pavwoski in court, in custody, with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #2.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #2.  Counts 1 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  Count #4 is dismissed by operation of law. State makes recommendations.  Attorney Rumpf makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #2.  

190 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 38 days).  Sentence commences immediately.

FINE:  $2502.00

DNA Surcharge: $200.00

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Waukesha Sheriff Department.

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 3/1/2017. Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 27 days in Huber consecutive

DL REVOCATION:  30 months.

IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 30 months.

Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel 

AODA Assessment and follow through
